page.title: 02The Buildings of Brereton.
page.content: Visitors entering the village of Brereton from the A50 coming South would immediately be struck by the beauty of the{Bears Head Hotel}on their left.Built in the old black and white style,it was completed in the year 1615,and was a stopping point for stage-coaches on the London to Manchester route.It is still a thriving hotel and catering nowadays for the travellers of the eighties and every year is a meeting place for the Cheshire Hunt. Further along this road is the centre of the village,and visitors would see on their left,a very imposing{archway. Through this arch runs the lane down to the church of St.Oswalds and Brereton Hall.The archway of the old Lodges have always been a village landmark and are often used for photograhic purposes.
